title: Three companies to partner on GTO rideshare launch services
summary:
Three rideshare launch service providers are joining forces to support launches to geostationary orbit.

title: Maxar signs $35 million satellite intelligence deals in Asia-Pacific region
summary:
The contracts are part of Maxar's "direct access” program that enables customers to directly control satellite tasking through their own ground stations

title: Vast signs agreement with SpaceX for private astronaut missions to the ISS
summary:
Commercial space station developer Vast Space signed a deal with SpaceX for two private astronaut missions to the ISS, pending NASA approval.
The post Vast signs agreement with SpaceX for private astronaut missions to the ISS appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA, Axiom Space Change Assembly Order of Commercial Space Station
summary: In coordination with NASA, Axiom Space modified its planned assembly sequence to accelerate its ability to operate as a viable free-flying space station and reduce International Space Station reliance during assembly. NASA awarded Axiom Space a firm-fixed price, indefinite-delivery, indefinite-quantity contract in January 2020, as the agency continues to open the space station for commercial […]

title: Firefly wins NASA contract for third lunar lander mission
summary:
NASA selected Firefly Aerospace for a third lunar lander mission, this one including a rover, to launch in 2028.
The post Firefly wins NASA contract for third lunar lander mission appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: ESA and Avio sign contracts for Vega upgrades and new launch
summary:
Avio has signed contracts with ESA for upgrades to the Vega rocket and its launch facilities, as well as for the launch of an Earth science mission.
The post ESA and Avio sign contracts for Vega upgrades and new launch appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Cosmic jingles: listen to Euclid’s image of M78
summary: An ethereal dance of misty clouds of interstellar dust with a myriad of distant stars and galaxies speckled like paint drops over a black canvas. This is a sonification of a breathta king image taken by ESA's Euclid space telescope of the young star-forming region Messier 78.

title: ESA Awards €350M to Avio to Boost Vega C and Develop Vega E
summary:
The European Space Agency has awarded Avio two contracts worth a total of €350 million to boost the launch cadence of Vega C and to complete the development of the company’s next-gen Vega E rocket. Vega E is a planned three-stage rocket that is expected to be introduced in 2027. It will retain the first […]
The post ESA Awards €350M to Avio to Boost Vega C and Develop Vega E appeared first on European Spaceflight.
